text: Flexible, production-quality smoke, fire, and explosions shader.
This shader can be used to create realistic renders of smoke, fire, and explosions simulations or procedurally generated volumes.

The combination of these two components make up the final volume render. Some renders such as chimney smoke, dust clouds, and other generic smoke elements only need to be shaded as smoke. Smoke is mainly controlled by its density and color. Emission on the other hand, controls the overall intensity and color of light emitted by the fire.
Each of these components relies on a set of volumes to do its work. A
volume is usually bound to the smoke component, and parameters in the
tab control its resulting look. You can use up to 3 emissive elements with this shader:

, which can have the effect of internal scattering pre-baked. Although this scattering is an approximation to true behavior, this approach is much cheaper to render compared to using volume lights and a high number of volume bounces. It also gives you greater artistic control over the look.
